text: <@U1L6PRGTF> I got it resolved, there was a small bug in my code with respect to using camel case :disappointed:
Used camel case in my Update[], but didn't realize I have to use in result too :disappointed:
spend a lot of time resolving it, finally got it
Thank you so much for your help :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U1VT657T4> I'm glad you got it resolved.
FYI, the "run_lint" command has some a new options that can really reduce the time it takes to run, etc.:
Based on a recent PR, developers will need to do `python setup.py clean —all; python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/validator and a `python setup.py build` in sawtooth-core/signing

<@U1ZUSJHAA> I see the update briefly but will look deeper tomorrow.
One quick question (and may have just missed it in the code) but how will the config pick up the whitelist? Do we need handling in the config parser for it? At one point we could just throw anything in the json file and it would magically appear wherever you wanted to grab it in the code. <@U0YQQRNU8> is that still the case or is that locked down?
As this is kind of a stepping stone to a more interesting policy, I'd like to avoid too many hurdles to get the whitelist to the txn family validation logic.

Great. <@U1ZUSJHAA> please add a sample config file that adds the white list public key set.  In general we are trying to minimize that config file, but we'll use it and use it in this manner for now.
Of course the public keys won't be directly useful, but will be illustrative of the use.
Config file should also have the txn family name. I think that's about it though. Everything else would come from defaults.
